qas.question: Where did Anwar El Sadat make a trip to?
What did Sadat and Begin sign?

context: The 1977 Knesset elections marked a major turning point in Israeli political history as Menachem Begin's Likud party took control from the Labor Party. Later that year, Egyptian President Anwar El Sadat made a trip to <a0_0>Israel<a0_0/> and spoke before the Knesset in what was the first recognition of Israel by an Arab head of state. In the two years that followed, Sadat and Begin signed the <a1_0>Camp David Accords<a1_0/> (1978) and the Israel–Egypt Peace Treaty (1979). In return, Israel withdrew from the <a2_0>Sinai Peninsula<a2_0/>, which Israel had captured during the Six-Day War in 1967, and agreed to enter negotiations over an autonomy for Palestinians in the West Bank and the Gaza Strip.
